main.name: Jessica Bradham
main.description: I am a front end web developer and designer, I currently use html5, css3, javascript, and react. I use tools such as npm, create-react-app, git and github, and most of the adobe creative suite
main.bio: In 2007 I went to Kendall College of Art & Design as a Digital Media Design Major, I tested out of many of my lower level design classes and opted to take higher level classes. In doing so I was able to learn outside of my major and ended up taking all of the school's courses in Web Development and Design. In my work as a professional designer, I've used these skills more and more, first having been asked to create ebooks, then multimedia ebooks (read-along, and with embedded video), and interactive ebooks using javascript with drag and drop elements and buttons. Later I was asked to prototype designs for new webpages, and create small web games for the kids visiting our website (including puzzles, painting games, dress up games, etc.) Soon after that I was prototyping our android apps in Unity. It was at this point I realized I was already doing web development professionaly, and I wanted to make it my full time task. All of the projects I was learning and growing as I worked, and I continued this process in my evening hours studying on my own time to improve my skills.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Skilled in Html, CSS, Javascript, Git, React, Html5 Canvas, Photoshop, Illustrator, Animate, and After Effects

education.school: Kendall College of Art and Design of Ferris State University
education.description: I majored in Digital Media Design, but having tested out of at least 5 of the lower level classes (a few of which included interaction design 1, animation 1, digital design for print 1, web design 1, web design 2) I was able to take interactive design 2, web design 3, and web design 4, along with sound design, motion graphics, 3D design, and a couple indepdent studies.

work.title: Technical Media Production Specialist & Designer
work.description: I was hired to assist in fixing a very long list of graphical, video, and audio bugs. Due to my efficiancy and technical knowledge I was able to clear the list entirely, and expand the role to other tasks managaging the previous tasks plus the new ones by myself when the only other person in the same position left. Expanded responsibilities included building ebooks in xhtml, building muiltmedia and interactive ebooks in xhtml, javascript, and json, prototyping webpages using the bootstrap framework, building small web games for the homepage, and prototyping apps.

work.title: Web Development Intern
work.description: I worked as an intern to help build the initial framework of websites based in Wordpress.

work.company: Kendall College of Art and Design
work.title: Adjunct Professor
work.description: Created curriculums for and taught classes in design and interation, my interaction design class focused on teaching students to design and build their first interactive project using html5 canvas with Javascript.

work.title: Lead Artist & Flash Programmer
work.description: Lead a team of remote artists for a web game, orangized content, created plotlines, drew illustrations, and made flash games.

work.company: Kendall College of Art and Design
work.title: Student Employement - Kendall Weblab
work.description: Worked as a student employee on the Kendall Weblab managing the student website, updating the layout, organizing and uploading content.

work.title: Designer & Developer
work.description: Programmed and illustrated original flash games.

projects.title: MediGrowth
projects.category: A web application developed to help people track symptoms and medical conditions, and share their journals with physicians. Built using Ruby, Sinatra, Activerecord, Chartkick, Sinatra Flash, and Sass.

projects.title: Wheel of Fortune: CLI App
projects.category: A Wheel of Fortune themed game I built to run in the commandline, plays like a one play version of Wheel of Fortune.

projects.title: Pizza Savant
projects.category: A responsive website I designed and built for a Pizza Restaurant, complete with a javascript menu, scroll animations, and the Google Maps API embedded.

projects.title: Do It Yourself Grooming
projects.category: Landing page I designed and built for a restaurant that sells dog grooming supplies and teaches grooming teachniques.

projects.title: Tip Calculator
projects.category: My own personal spin on the old school calculator project, a tip calculator that updates as you type.

projects.title: A History of Cheeseburgers
projects.category: An informational webpage with a timeline history of the cheeseburger.
